intro: Commelina zambesica, commonly known as Zambesian spiderwort, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant features striking blue to violet flowers with three petals and three sepals, often surrounded by white or pale green bracts. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and arranged alternately along the stem. Commelina zambesica is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
